Instruction: Heat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and grease a 10x10-inch baking dish.
Combine peaches, 1 1/2 cups sugar, and cinnamon in a medium bowl, stirring until thoroughly mixed; set aside.

Beat together the remaining 1 cup of sugar and shortening in a large bowl until fluffy. Combine flour, baking powder, and salt in a small bowl; add to the shortening mixture alternately with milk, mixing after each addition until just combined. Pour the biscuit batter into the greased baking dish and spoon the peach mixture on top. Pour the butter into boiling water and drizzle over the peaches.
Bake until the top is golden brown, which usually takes 40 to 45 minutes.
